goal.ch:
1.增進對哲學家德勒茲思想的理解
2.增進對當代法國哲學的認識
3.增進西方哲學史發展的理解
goal.en:
1.To increase students’ appreciation of philosopher Gilles Deleuze’s thought.
2.To advance students’ understanding of contemporary French philosophy.
3.To improve students’ comprehension of the history of Continental European philosophy.

outline.ch: 僅管法國當代哲學家德勒茲曾言，他的思想可粗略分為三個時期。第一時期即是哲學史時期，第二個時期是概念創造時期，第三個時期則是藝術時期。但這不代表這三個時期彼此無關，而是彼此互相關聯的。本學期研讀的《柏格森主義》即是第一個時期的代表，在這本書中，德勒茲通過對柏格森哲學中五個重要概念的討論，分別是直觀、綿延、記憶、同時性以及生命衝動，也為自己第二時期的「差異與重複」概念與第三時期的電影研究奠定了關鍵的基礎。
outline.en: French contemporary philosopher Gilles Deleuze (1925-1995) once said that his philosophical works could be roughly divided into three periods. The first period focused on the analysis of great philosopher’s concepts in order to create his own; the second period was marked by the completion and publication of his philosophical work Difference and Repetition, which has been considered as an outstanding oeuvre; the third period focused on the analysis of aesthetic elements of painting and cinema. These three periods are closely connected. Bergsonism to be read this semester belongs to the first period of Deleuze’s work, in which Deleuze analysed Bergson’s five concepts: Institution, Duration, Memory, Stimulation and Élan vital. The fruits of analysing Bergson’s concepts were also reflected in his later works, especially in his concepts of Difference and Image-Move-Time.

textbook.en:
1.Henri Bergson Matière et mémoire, P.U.F, Paris, 1939.
2.Henri Bergson Matter and Memory, translated by Nancy Margaret Paul and W. Scott Palmer, Zone Books, New York, 1991.
3.Gilles Deleuze Le Bergsonisme, P.U.F, Paris, 1966.
4.Gilles Deleuze Bergsonism, trans. By Hugh Tomlinson and Barbara Habberiam, Zone Books, New York, 1988.
5.Gilles Deleuze L’île desert et autres textes. Textes et entretiens 1953-1974. L’édition de Minuit, Paris, 2002.
6.Gilles Deleuze Desert Island and Other Texts (1953-1974), trans. By Michael Taomina, Semotext(e) Foreign Agents Series, Los Angeles, U.S.A, 2004.   
7.Valentine Moulard-Leonard Bergson-Deleuze Encounters Transcendental Experience and the Thought of the Virtual, State University of New York Press, New York, 2008.
